content.description:
Fun little climb. Could be modified for a sit start but it would be much harder. There are two ledges that work as good handholds for a standing start with feet on the smaller boulder below.

Some of the rock on this route is pretty rotten but it's been cleaned pretty good. Be prepared for loose rocks.

This climb is the second on the south side of the boulder. Looking at the south side, it is far to the right following a crack.
content.location:
Bambi's Mom Boulder.

Option 1:

Plug "45.311293, -113.906648" into any Gps and it should work

Option 2:

If you have access to google maps, plug "Tower Rock Recreation Site, North Fork Idaho" in.

Option 3:

Starting in Salmon, follow Highway 93 towards Montana for a little less than 10 miles. At the "Tower Rock Recreation Site" turn right into the parking lot.

After all options:

This is a boat launch just off the highway. Got to the end of the parking lot and park. Then walk past the picnic tables to the boulder.

content.description: Starting from a sit start, move up and to the left to eventually top out. The rock is of good quality on this climb. This one of two climbs on the south side of the boulder. Looking at the south side, it is furthest to the left.
